Laying spread eagle on the floor, the redhead scrambled back after catching her breath, getting space between herself and the zombie crawling after her.

Finding courage and strength in her fear, she got on her feet and ran toward the zombie, kicking it across the head, seemingly stunning it while she brought the hatchet done over and over and over again on the undead beast that surprised her.

Once she was sure it was dead, Amber shakily got up, the adrenaline and fear highenting her senses and making her heart pound in her chest. Inching back into the room, she saw it was just a bedroom, and a closet!

Swinging the door open, she was disappointed to see that it was empty, but she started searching the dressers still in the room. She did find a pair of socks and tennis shoes, but they were too small, so she settles for the sandals she found that had been brushed under the bed. And in the other dresser, she found a singlet t-shirt, but man, if it wasn't the apocalypse she'd never wear this thing.

It was a Hello Kitty t-shirt that was a good bit too small, coming down to about 2 inches above her belly button, and was way too baggy to offer her breasts any support.

"Why does the universe hate me?" Amber groaned to herself as she looked at herself in the mirror, braless, with a too-small shirt, a Dora backpack, and sandals. "Some zombie survivor outfit." She said, lamenting that's she'd never found a pair of wearable pants or panties since this whole mess started, leaving her lower half permanently exposed.

Deciding that the building was a good place to hole up for the rest of the day while she took everything that she could use from it, she dragged the zombie body out back and locked the door. She also closed all the blinds and locked all the windows on the first floor, before finally deciding to take a nap and figure out what to do later.
15123111.title: Leave out front while she can!

choices: It's her airhead friend Lilly, also a half naked survivor
It's a zombie!
151231111.content:
Amber groaned as she rolled over in the bed, "Ugh, Ben you'd never believe the dream I had." She mumbled as she stretched, before opening her eyes and realizeing that it wasn't a dream, it was really happening.

"I've got to eat if I'm going to survive." Amber said as she got out of bed, making sure to securely fasten her belt and hatchet, before heading over to the kitchen to see what food she had for lunch. As she walked in, she saw a radio and turned it on, and quickly turned the radio down to ensure that no zombies heard her up there.

"*static* An unknown *static* has unleashed an *static* that caused zombies to manifest *static* the world, there aren't *static* outposts of survivors left. If *static* hears this, you're not alone, you can find *static* at *schzzzzzzz*"

Amber pouted as the radio signal ended, "Darn, now I've got to see if I can find another station." But turning the dial didn't reveal anymore working radio stations, frustrated, she turned the TV on, muting the sound and turning in subtitles. As she scrolled through, she was astonished at how much had gone down, no radio, she left her phone in her apartment, and the landline here worked, but no one was picking up.

Eventually on channel 3, she saw a program working. The news Anchor was sitting at her desk topless, the studio logo placed crookedly over her chest.

"This is Lily Kwan with what's left of the Channel 3 staff, and I'm letting you know that if you make to the broadcast tower on the northern end of town, we are here, not much of us, but we are here."

Cheering, Amber danced a bit in the kitchen, glad that's she wasn't alone, but at that moment, the power cut out. Sighing, Amber decided to finally grab lunch.

Pulling out a pack of deli turkey from the fridge and some bread, she made a simple turkey sandwich, and decided to observe the zombies, to get a better idea of what she was dealing with.

Looking out the window, she saw that the zombies were wandering around in small groups, no more than four, no less than two, and none of them seemed capable of fast movement, either stumbling around slowly or crawling if they couldn't. Nodding to herself, Amber realized that's it'd be best if she cut her hair, it was fairly long, and the least thing she needed was to get it caught by a zombie's hand.

Finishing her sandwich, she headed over to the bathroom and found a pair of scissors and roughly cut her hair into a pixie cut, her hair not going any further than her jaw. As she walked down the hall, she thought she heard something stumble around downstairs, drawing her hatchet, she creeped over to the stairs.

"Hello?" Amber called out, hoping it was a fellow survivor, "Anyone there?"
151231111.title: Gathering supplies/recon the zombies

choices: Finding a place to camp for the night
Encounter other survivors
1512311111.content:
"Amber, is that you?" A familiarity voice called up from downstairs.

"Lilly!" Amber cried out, "Come upstairs!"

"Ok!" Lilly giggled a bit before Amber heard her stumble and hit something, "Ow."

As Lilly came up the stairs, Amber couldn't believe her eyes, Lilly, the model of their group of friends, was wearing a thong and a torn white tank top, and with those E-cup breasts that the blonde had, there was no hiding that she wasn't wearing a bra.

"Lilly," Amber began, "what happened to your clothes?"

"Hmm?" Lilly looked down, "Oh yeah, I was in a shoot and I had to pee really badly, so I went, and then everyone started acting like a zombie, and I didn't like to dress up like a zombie, so I left and everyone is acting like a zombie." Lilly paused and tapped her chin, "Are they making a movie here?"

Amber face palmed, "Lilly, they are real zombies."

Lilly gasped, "Really!? I gotta see if I can get an autograph!"

Amber jumped forward, grabbing her friend, "No, Lilly, they will kill you. Just like in the movies but for real."

"Oh." Lilly looked away with a sad face, "So what do we do?"

"There's a group of survivors up at the broadcast station on the other end of town, if we make it there, we can work out what to do next." Amber looked Lilly over. "We need to get you a weapon."

Lilly nodded and followed Amber back into the kitchen. "Hey Amber, where's your pants?"

Amber growled, "I woke up, lost my panties, and never got a chance to get pants."

Lilly giggled, imagining Amber running around bottomless for everyone to see, which wasn't too far from what she was wearing, a string snaps and she's bottomless too, not that she recognized that fact.

Amber turned around holding a sledgehammer, "Do you want this, or my hatchet?"

Lilly looked the hammer over, and looked at the hatchet and belt, which Lilly thought would match her tank top so much better than the sledgehammer. "I want the hatchet. The belt matches my shirt."

Amber sighed and handed over her belt and hatchet, stepping back and giving the hammer a few swings, getting the feel for it. When suddenly, they heard shuffling and groaning downstairs.

"Lilly, how'd you get in?" Amber asked nervously.

"I reached in the doggy door to unlock the door, why?"

"Never mind, we've got to go." Amber grabbed Lilly's hand and pulled her down the stairs with her, throwing the front door open and leaving before the zombies could get to them.

Running across the street, the two were able to avoid getting caught by any zombies, but Lilly was having trouble buckling her belt. "Help?" Lilly asked.

"Fine." Amber said, bending over at the waist, exposing her nether regions to anyone behind her, "Hold still."

As Amber got the belt buckle properly secured, Lilly screamed and pushed Amber aside, before she heard a *thunk*, and a zombie with a crushed head fell down beside her. Amber looked up at Lilly, who was holding the now bloody sledgehammer in a white-knuckle grip and a wide-eyed expression.

"Thank Lil." Amber said, dusting her butt off before grabbing her sledgehammer from Lilly and leading the way from the real estate building that they had to evacuate. But Amber hadn't noticed that her sandals had fallen off, too distracted by her adrenaline, nor had she seen the one-armed zombie following them from behind.
1512311111.title: It's her airhead friend Lilly, also a half ...

choices: Amber leaves Lilly behind
A bare morning
15123111111.content:
As the two barely dressed girls wandered through the shadows of their city, Amber realized that she'd forgotten her backpack at the building in their hurry to escape.

"Well what are we gonna do now?" Lilly asked, fiddling with the hem of her tank top, "We don't have any food, and it's getting dark."

Amber groaned and looked around the area before deciding on heading toward an abandoned bakery nearby. "We'll hole up in here for the night." Amber said as she cautiously opened the door, making sure that there weren't any zombies inside. "Let's look for a place to sleep."

Lilly, after being reassured that it was safe to enter, practically skipped into the bakery as if nothing was wrong, "Oh boy! A sleepover in a bakery!"

'I swear the only reason she's still alive is that her head is filled with hot air..' Amber thought to herself

*SNAP*

"Oh, shoot." Lilly said from behind the counter, "My thong snapped." Amber sighed as Lilly came over to her with a frowning face, holding the broken thong in her hands, "Think we can fix it?"

"No Lilly, we don't have anything to fix it with, you'll just have to go without. Just like me." Amber gestured to her exposed bush below her borrowed childish shirt.

"Ok!" Lilly dropped the thong and continued looking for food as if nothing had been wrong earlier.

While Lilly gathered up food, Amber set to barricading the door and windows of the bakery, intent on keeping as many of the undead as possible outside for a change. But as she placed a piece of broken table against her window barricade, she heard a *ssshhhrrriiiiiip!*, looking down, her shirt had been torn in half, exposing her C-cups to the open air.

*ssshhhrrriiiiiip!* She heard from behind, looking over, she saw Lilly holding a now torn in two tank top, grinning from ear to ear.

"Lilly," Amber asked, trying to remain calm, "why'd you just rip your shirt in half?"

"You said to be like you, so I am!" Lilly said as if it was the most obvious thing in the world.

"No I said...never mind!" Amber continued to build her defenses in silence, with a bit more force than what was probably needed, all the while trying to figure out if staying with Lilly was a good decision in the long run. But, she was able to finish her work in peace, and Lilly did find enough food for the both of them before laying on the improvised beds that were the booths built into the walls. And the two naked girls drifted off to a restless night.
15123111111.title: Finding a place to camp for the night

choices: Waits to see who is at the door
Climbs above and out of the elevator
Other
1513.content:
Looking around, Amber saw she was the only one in the hallways. Terrified of the thing Ben had become, she realized that her safest bet was to find her buildings security. Problem was, the security was on the ground floor and the elevator was slow.
"Screw it," Amber thought, "It'll be safer than out in the open."
As she made her way from her apartment, Amber could hear a loud pounding coming from inside. It grew louder and louder as she came closer to the elevator. "Shit!" She thought to herself, "Ben's still that crazy thing."
She kept pressing the elvevator call button faster and faster as the pounds grew harder and faster. Amber was on edge from only being in a white shirt and her blue and white striped panties. The lack of cover made her feel even more like prey.
The elevator had finally reached her after a few more seconds of dread. However when she entered the worst possible thing happened, Ben had broke down the door and was rabidly charging after Amber. "Shit! Shit! Shit!" Amber exclaimed. Ben moved mindlessly at his prey, not carrying about their previous relationship
Right as he was nearly a foot away from Amber the elevator doors shut, preventing Amber from being his next meal.
Amber was terrified, the tragedy of the moments prior had finally hit her as she crouched down in the right corner of the elevator. "He's gone, he really is gone," Amber thought. Ben was her rock, how could she go on with out him.
Suddenly the elevator stopped right before the security office. "What the hell!" Amber shouted. The redhead than remembered how the elevator never was reliable before. Good news was that the top of the elevator had a hatch to evacuate from. Bad news was that somebody or something began pounding on the door. Amber had to decide how the hell she's going to get out of this
1513.title: Take the lift to the lobby security

info.brief_description: This story follows Amber a red haired woman through the zombie apocalypse with ENF themes
info.description: Amber is a red haired woman in her early 20s, she is of a slim build with medium sized breasts. No rape allowed including non consensual sexual actions touch is okay just not too far. Amber can die however, it must end the story so consider actions which may be a wrong turn. Any character Amber meets may also die. No TF or shrinking. Other than that have fun and try and keep Amber with limited clothes for a long as possible.
